basicInfo.name: Vincent Jang
basicInfo.title: Backend Engineer
basicInfo.tagline: Rather than a engineer who shines alone, I aspire to be like the moon, harmonizing with the light of others.
basicInfo.introduction: I'm a backend engineer passionate about building products I would personally want to use — driven by curiosity and solving real problems. With extensive startup experience, I've helped improve workflows, led communication across teams, and even established internal libraries, frameworks, and coding conventions from the ground up. Always eager to learn, I thrive on exploring new languages and architectures, recently diving into Go, Flutter, and system-level design.

education.school: Seoul National University of Science and Technology

personalProjects.name: Timespace
personalProjects.description: VS Code extension displaying local and UTC time in the status bar

VSQUARE.summary: Handled frontend integration, CMS development, backend logic, and API development. Contributed to significant revenue growth within two quarters by delivering stable academic and LMS platforms for universities and public institutions.

projects.name: Chongshin University
projects.description: Integrated academic systems for student lookup, certificate printing, and legacy migration; handled publishing and responsive frontend tasks.

projects.name: Jaseng Korean Medicine Hospital
projects.description: Implemented internal email system, LMS certificate PDFs, and paid lecture coupon features; handled frontend publishing and API integration.

projects.name: Korea Women’s Human Rights Institute
projects.description: Built full LMS frontend logic from sign-up to certificate printing; developed carousel animation and member flow logic.

projects.name: Jeonghwa Arts University
projects.description: Developed academic information system with CMS integration, including Chart.js visualizations, data tables, and API endpoints.

projects.name: Childcare Meal Management Support Center
projects.description: Built meal plan CMS, including editable menu features, recipe management, and nutrition statistics export.

projects.name: Meal Plan Service
projects.description: Developed meal plan editing, API endpoints, and LMS business logic, enabling Excel nutrition statistics export.

projects.name: Project Cygnus
projects.description: E-commerce solution built with Spring and MyBatis; implemented product management, category handling, payment gateway integration, and preview features.

CatzeLabs.summary: Led backend architecture for Web3 game platforms, token conversion systems, and internal tools. Contributed to four Web3 hackathon wins and ConsenSys investment. Migrated legacy batch systems to real-time processing and implemented secure communications with gRPC and 2FA.

projects.name: Yooldo
projects.description: Full backend development for NFT-based P2E platform serving 900K+ users. Implemented Web3 indexers, real-time token ↔ game currency conversions, Google OAuth, and anti-abuse judicial system.

projects.name: Alice-bot
projects.description: Discord bot for CyberGalz community integrating virtual currency economy and Twitter-based content filters; linked with other CatzeLabs products.

projects.name: KUP
projects.description: NFT & Metaverse hackathon project at KlayMakers22; awarded 1st place in track. Involved in initial planning and architecture discussions.

projects.name: R3plica
projects.description: Hackathon project winning 2nd place (BNB Chain) and 1st place (Coinbase Buidle The Future). Built backend APIs, table schema, and Web3 indexers.

projects.name: Aptoplay
projects.description: Hackathon-winning game platform (Aptos Seoul Hack 2023). Built complete backend and published aptoplay-core library to npm.

projects.name: Aptoplay-core
projects.description: Reusable library for Aptoplay; handles core Web3 gaming logic and state synchronization.

projects.name: Trouble Punk Game Server
projects.description: P2E game server for Cybergalz ‘Trouble-punk’ using Firebase Firestore; implemented league and reward settlement systems.

projects.name: Catze Backoffice
projects.description: Comprehensive internal management system integrating Google OAuth, Slack OTP, and QR-based 2FA. Managed multiple products via unified dashboard.

projects.name: Catze Nest Logger
projects.description: Decorator-based NestJS logger enabling automatic method tracing and log injection; initiated company-wide logging standards.

projects.name: Catze Nest Crypto
projects.description: Bidirectional encryption library implementing envelope encryption; used across CatzeLabs internal services for secure payload handling.

projects.name: Brickgirls
projects.description: Telegram Web3 game publishing platform; designed RDB schema, APIs, and Telegram Bot integration for gameplay events.

Gomble.summary: Serving as Tech Lead, handled large-scale events like TGE and Launchpool #3, ensuring stable processing of 4K–60K RPS traffic. Improved server infrastructure, backend code quality, and internal conventions while resolving technical debt and enhancing data visibility for business decisions.

projects.name: Minigame Server
projects.description: Unified server for multiple minigames within Gomble Squad. Established backend template and coding conventions across the team.

projects.name: Gomble Squad
projects.description: Implemented large-scale Launchpool #3 event; introduced Redash for business-level data visibility and analytics.

projects.name: TGE
projects.description: Handled 4K–60K req/sec traffic during token generation event; integrated Web3 asset indexing for accurate event data processing.

projects.name: Gomble Builders
projects.description: Developed NFT-based voting system to select in-game characters. Implemented NFT indexing and optimized infrastructure costs via ECR/ECS.

projects.name: Mew Survivor
projects.description: External game server project integrating Google/Apple OAuth login and in-app purchase (IAP) logic.
